item.title: HW 1
item.description: 1 You observe that a population of dragonflies show oscillatory patterns, i.e. population density is changing roughly periodically with time. Propose two hypotheses- with a brief reasoning for each of them - for the observed patterns.(5 Marks) Response Changing seasons could be affecting food availability, leading to alternating increases and decreases. An interspecific competition with either species gaining the upper hand for a while before the other adapts. 2 What is the interpretation of K in the population equation \(N_{t+1} = N_t(1-\dfrac{N_t}{k})\).
